Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Disable flaky test" (#8232) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "Disable flaky test" (#8232) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Fix flaky test NuGetGallery.PackagesControllerFacts+TheDisplayPackageMethod.OneSecondCacheTime" (#8231) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug

This test is flaky:

```
##[error]    NuGetGallery.PackagesControllerFacts+TheDisplayPackageMethod.OneSecondCacheTime [FAIL]

      Assert.Empty() Failure
      Collection: []
      Stack Trace:
        tests\NuGetGallery.Facts\Controllers\PackagesControllerFacts.cs(2023,0): at NuGetGallery.PackagesControllerFacts.TheDisplayPackageMethod.<OneSecondCacheTime>d__48.MoveNext()
        --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
           at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
           at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
        --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
           at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
           at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
        --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
           at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
           at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
```

### Additional context

It failed in this CI run:
https://nuget.visualstudio.com/NuGetBuild/_build/results?buildId=74219&view=logs&j=fd490c07-0b22-5182-fac9-6d67fe1e939b&t=8387211e-0f7c-5960-ee6f-4bc6a15f97b1&l=57

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Delete unused Grunt scripts and add .eslintignore" (#8227) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This gives us a clean ESLint report, per SDL required rules.

- Add `.eslintignore` file to not run ESLint on 3rd party scripts that are required for our product
- Update lodash to address npm audit issue (unrelated to ESLint)
- Remove Grunt tasks that we never call
- Remove Bootstrap tests that we never run and were long ago removed by getting rid of the `grunt test` task

Address https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3251.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Package Manager Console should be more clear about unsupported projects" (#9421) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Solutions which have no NuGet-supported projects are causing "Package Manager Console" to show cryptic error messages.

A more preferred option would be to disable the console pane, or have some overlaying message inside the console which indicates there's nothing that this console can currently do.

At a minimum, improving the error that's shown would be more clear to the user:
Current error: "Project 'Default' is not found."
Suggestion: "The current solution doesn't contain any projects which support NuGet packages"

Here's someone failing to install a package with a "Report Server" project with this same issue:
https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/1215#issuecomment-538433452

Stack Overflow: [VS2017 NuGet 'Get-Package -ListAvailable' fails once solution opened](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/43336003/vs2017-nuget-get-package-listavailable-fails-once-solution-opened)

NuGet product used: VS
Worked before? No

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Open a Python Solution in Visual Studio.
2. Open the Package Manager Console window
3. Observe that no Default projects are available:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/79004750-66622000-7b23-11ea-974d-e1caf9718b82.png)
4. Attempt to run a command such as `get-project`.
5. An error occurs due to the console being unable to choose a project in which to run this command.

> get-project : Project 'Default' is not found.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/79004859-93aece00-7b23-11ea-9233-5b7d8fdb197c.png)


## Expected

Package Manager Console is either disabled, or shows a clear error message when the solution contains no supported projects.

Events.RelatedBody:
Solutions which have no NuGet-supported projects are causing "Package Manager Console" to show cryptic error messages.

A more preferred option would be to disable the console pane, or have some overlaying message inside the console which indicates there's nothing that this console can currently do.

At a minimum, improving the error that's shown would be more clear to the user:

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Improve PMC errors for projects that do not support nuget" (#4281) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Improve PMC errors for projects that do not support nuget

NuGet 4.0.0-rc3 on VS 2017 (not a regression)

### Steps
1. Create a new Azure Data Lake > Pig Application
1. Install-Package nuget.versioning

### Expected
A friendly message saying that the project does not support NuGet.

### Actual
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6381138/21947661/1bc62e7e-d99b-11e6-8831-b774061839f3.png)

The UI solves this by disabling the Manage NuGet Packages, PMC should handle this better also.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Remove IPackageSourceProvider2 and related types" (#10098) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
we created a few types in 16.8p3
we want to remove them, but the clock is out for 16.8.
we hope to insert a simple addition of [Obsolete] to the new apis in p4.
likely will be able to remove in 16.9.

this issue is linked from the obsolete attributes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Warning for warning NU5128 when packastool with targetframework alias" (#10097) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
---
**Issue moved from dotnet/sdk#13928**
- Please respond to @wli3.

---

_From @wli3 on Wednesday, September 30, 2020 9:03:56 PM_

Given
```
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">

  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>targetframeworkAlias</TargetFramework>
    <PackAsTool>true</PackAsTool>
    <OutputType>exe</OutputType>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <PropertyGroup Condition=" '$(TargetFramework)' == 'targetframeworkAlias' ">
    <TargetFrameworkIdentifier>.NETCoreApp</TargetFrameworkIdentifier>
    <TargetFrameworkVersion>v3.1</TargetFrameworkVersion>
    <TargetFrameworkMoniker>.NETCoreApp,Version=v3.1</TargetFrameworkMoniker>
  </PropertyGroup>

</Project>

```

run dotnet pack. There will be an extra necessary warning:
```
C:\work\sdk3\artifacts\bin\redist\Debug\dotnet\sdk\5.0.100-dev\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\build\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(207,5): warning NU5128: Some target frameworks declared in the dependencies group of the nuspec and the lib/ref folder do not have exact matches in the other location. Consult the list of actions below: [C:\work\temp\nugetalias\nugetalias.csproj]
C:\work\sdk3\artifacts\bin\redist\Debug\dotnet\sdk\5.0.100-dev\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\build\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(207,5): warning NU5128: - Add lib or ref assemblies for the netcoreapp3.1 target framework [C:\work\temp\nugetalias\nugetalias.csproj]
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Contributing: Is the Windows 10 SDK actually needed?" (#10096) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Encountered in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3697.

I think the SDK is *needed* for running integration/E2E tests, but not for building. Maybe that can be clarified.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Nuget PMUI throws StreamJsonRPC exception" (#10070) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
Not sure if it's regression.

1. Open Nuget.Client source code in VS
2. Install Text2Xml(v 1.1.0) package into all projects.
3. Try to downgrade Text2Xml(v 1.0.1) version.
![Error1.PNG](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5eb1d84a3cd56675c3efe510/eef97020-4a36-4d02-b443-feeb6a8835ef)

Related issues: 
https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1218071
https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1216957
